pullRequest.body:
Preparation for results using families of pseudometrics


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f345964087](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23111/commits/f3459640873ff230647160dce10223d695cf9b4c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.BundledFun` (new file)|628|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsUltra`
`+ IsUltra.bot`
`+ IsUltra.finsetSup`
`+ IsUltra.sup`
`+ PseudoMetric`
`+ bot_apply`
`+ coe_bot`
`+ coe_le_coe_iff_le`
`+ coe_mk`
`+ finsetSup_apply`
`+ instance : Bot (PseudoMetric X R)`
`+ instance : FunLike (PseudoMetric X R) X (X → R)`
`+ instance : LE (PseudoMetric X R) := ⟨fun d d' ↦ ⇑d ≤ d'⟩`
`+ instance : Max (PseudoMetric X R)`
`+ instance : OrderBot (PseudoMetric X R)`
`+ instance : PartialOrder (PseudoMetric X R)`
`+ instance : SemilatticeSup (PseudoMetric X R)`
`+ isSymmetricRel_ball`
`+ isTransitiveRel_ball_of_isTriangleMax`
`+ mk_apply`
`+ nonneg`
`+ refl`
`+ sup_apply`
`+ symm`
`+ triangle`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I don't hugely like how this new file is under `MetricSpace` given that it's precisely not about metric spaces! Maybe it should move to a new `Topology.Metric` folder (and possibly `Topology.MetricSpace` could become `Topology.Metric.Space`?)

Maybe just
```suggestion
structure PseudoMetric where
```
since informally you say "a metric", not "a metric function"?

```suggestion
The `PseudoMetricFun` definition works over any ordered commutative additive monoid,
```
is what you mean, I guess?

```suggestion
  coe_injective' a := by aesop
```

```suggestion
@[simp, norm_cast]
lemma coe_mk (d : X → X → R) (refl symm triangle) : mk d refl symm triangle = d := rfl
    
lemma mk_apply (d : X → X → R) (refl symm triangle) (x y : X) :
    mk d refl symm triangle x y = d x y :=
  rfl
```

nit:
```suggestion
instance : LE (PseudoMetricFun X R) := ⟨fun d d' ↦ ⇑d ≤ d'⟩
```
I would certainly make this simp and norm_cast the other way around. Also can `d`, `d'` be made implicit?

Can you inline? to make sure no one tries using `bot` directly
```suggestion
instance : Bot (PseudoMetricFun X R) where
  bot.toFun := 0
  bot.refl' _ := rfl
  bot.symm' _ _ := rfl
  bot.triangle' _ _ _ := by simp
```
Can we have `coe_bot`?
Same as above

```suggestion
def IsNonarch (d : PseudoMetricFun X R) : Prop :=
```
or
```suggestion
def IsUltra (d : PseudoMetricFun X R) : Prop :=
```
? I don't think `IsTriangleMax` is a particularly inspiring name

```suggestion
protected lemma IisTriangleMax_.sup {d d' : PseudoMetricFun X R} (hd : IsTriangleMax d)
    (hd' : IsTriangleMax d') : IsTriangleMax (d ⊔ d') := by
```

```suggestion
protected lemma IsTriangleMax.bot : IsTriangleMax (⊥ : PseudoMetricFun X R) := by
```

```suggestion
instance : PartialOrder (PseudoMetric X R) := .lift _ DFunLike.coe_injective
```

```suggestion
    (d ⊔ d') x y = d x y ⊔ d' x y := rfl
```
Can we have `coe_sup`?

```suggestion
  exact this.ne' (d.refl x)
```
Can we have `@[simp, norm_cast] lemma coe_finsetSup`?

```suggestion
lemma IsUltra.isTransitiveRel_ball {d : PseudoMetric X R} (ε : R)
```
I would suggest making `ε` implicit in this and the next
I think these assumptions should be included in the theorems, not the definition.

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/MetricSpace): pseudometrics as bundled functions
